title: Web Proposal Writing eBook
description:
Learn how to write a Web design proposal
	 
Why does a client choose one Web consultant over another?

    * Is it because one is cheaper than the other?
      Not always. My fees are often higher than my competitors&#039;.
    * Is it because one firm is bigger than the other?
      No. I&#039;m a one-man company and I regularly win pitches against larger, more-established firms.
    * Is it because one firm is more local?
      Definitely not. I work with clients in Ontario, all over the United Kingdom and Paris, France.

So how do you make clients choose you instead of one of your competitors? By proving you&#039;re capable of meeting clients&#039; requirements.

So why are clients choosing to work with me rather than one of my many bigger and more-established competitors? Because I have a tried and tested process of determining what clients want and convincing them that I can deliver it. It&#039;s a step-by-step process that you can learn and duplicate from my guide, Web Proposal Writing.
Step One: Find out what clients want.

This is what I call the Needs Analysis stage. I go through a series of questions that helps me to determine:

    * What the client&#039;s business does
    * Why customers buy from them
    * Who their competitors are
    * What their objectives are for their site
    * When their deadline is
    * How often they will update the site and how they will do it
    * What style of design do they like

This guide contains a sample questionnaire that you can use to analyse how best to meet your clients&#039; needs.
Step Two: Write a professional proposal.

Once you&#039;ve found out exactly what it is that your clients want, you&#039;re ready to begin writing your proposal. And because you&#039;ve used a simple question and answer process during the Needs Analysis step, the task becomes so much easier.

In only two hours, you could produce a winning project proposal to convince your client that they should choose you.

So, how can you produce professional Web proposals?

By getting the guide - Web Proposal Writing - you&#039;ll learn the process I use to win projects worth thousands. Despite being a one-man company, I consistently win pitches against bigger, better-resourced and more-established competitors - even though my prices may be higher.
